duties_responsibilities.duty: Assist with HRIS compliance (Workday), data integrity, facilitation, and training for other departments during HRIS implementation and transition phases.
Collaborate with the parent company to install processes and procedures.
Serve as the sole HR individual and plan new hire orientation.

Monitor and solve personnel issues, assist with investigations, recognition programs, maintaining employee files, addressing customer requests or concerns, and routine daily support of all HR processes.
Support job architecture design and documentation.
Support execution of on-the-job training initiatives and developments, including appropriate recording and scheduling of trainings.
Manage regular employee workforce, including retention, turnover, and reporting.
Assist with termination process and disciplinary/corrective action reporting and documentation.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Psychology, Business, or related discipline, or equivalent work experience.
